org.openliberty.openaz.azapi.pep
Interface JavaObjectMapper

public interface JavaObjectMapper

JavaObjectMapper is responsible for converting a POJO (typically a native Java Object from the application space that contains one or more attributes to be used for authorization decisions) into a RequestAttributes<T> object, which is a wrapper for an AzEntity<T>.

The conversion, for the most part, consists of taking members from the native Java Object and using them to set attributes of the RequestAttributes<T> object that is passed to the map(java.lang.Object, org.openliberty.openaz.azapi.pep.RequestAttributes) method. Basically mapping the information in the native Java Object to a set of simple name-value pairs.

JavaObjectMappers are configured for each of the RequestAttributesFactory<T> instances associated with the PepRequestFactory. This allows for each AzCategoryId (AzCategoryIdSubjectAccess, AzCategoryIdAction, AzCategoryIdResource and AzCategoryIdEnvironment) to have its own mapper.

Author:
Josh Bregman, Rich Levinson, Prateek Mishra
See Also:
RequestAttributes

Method Detail

canMapObject

boolean canMapObject(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns true if the Mapper can map the Object that is passed in as the parameter to this method, false otherwise.

Parameters:
obj - Java Object (ex: Permission) which contains one or more attributes, generally from the application space that needs to be mapped to a RequestAttributes object
Returns:
true if this JavaObjectMapper can map the obj, false otherwise

map

<T extends java.lang.Enum<T> & AzCategoryId> RequestAttributes<T> map(java.lang.Object javaObject,
                                                                     RequestAttributes<T> azWrapperObject)
                                                                 throws PepException
Performs the mapping of an Object to a RequestAttributes<T> object.

Note: the map method is called with a specific subtype of RequestAttributes<T>. Typically, the map method will test the generic parameter using Attributes.getAzEntity().getAzCategoryId()

Note: the reason for returning a reference to the RequestAttributes is simply to allow for a mapper to reuse some existing state, such as a cached AzEntity, if such a strategy is desired. In such a case, the JavaObjectMapper would need to use the passed in RequestAttributes to obtain the parent PepRequest and then get the AzRequestContext and replace the AzEntity in the AzRequestContext the cached AzEntity.

Parameters:
javaObject -
azWrapperObject -
Returns:
a RequestAttributes object
Throws:
PepException

getSupportedClasses

java.util.Set<java.lang.Class> getSupportedClasses()
Returns a Set of all the classes that are supported by the Mapper that implements this interface.

Returns:
a set of class objects
